thread.title: Around college football | Fill-in QB tosses two TD passes as Bearcats bounce Hurricanes | Buckeye Xtra Sports
thread.title_full: Around college football | Fill-in QB tosses two TD passes as Bearcats bounce Hurricanes | Buckeye Xtra Sports

title: Around college football | Fill-in QB tosses two TD passes as Bearcats bounce Hurricanes | Buckeye Xtra Sports
text:
Cincinnati 34, Miami 23: Hayden Moore threw two touchdown passes and ran for another score in his starting debut, and Cincinnati’s struggling defense held on for a 34-23 victory over Miami on Thursday night to end the Hurricanes’ streak of 10 straight victories over the Bearcats.
Moore, a redshirt freshman, followed up the best passing game in Cincinnati history with a solid performance. The Bearcats (3-2) surged ahead 14-3 and overcame a scoreless third quarter behind Moore, who was 22 of 33 for 279 yards with an interception.
Moore filled in for Gunner Kiel, who was out because of a neck injury suffered during a 53-46 loss at Memphis last week. Moore took over in that game and passed for a school-record 557 yards, with four touchdowns and two interceptions, in only three quarters.
>> Get the most out of college football season, follow @BuckeyeXtra on Twitter 
>> Click for details on how to win tickets and trips to OSU games from  Dispatch  Reader Rewards 
>> Predict Ohio State vs. Indiana, plus other games 
Miami (3-1) was coming off a 36-33 victory over Nebraska that featured five field goals by Michael Badgley. He made three Thursday but missed from 51 and 53 yards as the Hurricanes repeatedly could not reach the end zone.
Trailing by 11 points, the Hurricanes went for it on fourth-and-goal from the 5 instead of taking the field goal. Brad Kaaya’s pass was incomplete with 4:41 left. Kaaya finished 24 of 39 for 255 yards without a touchdown or interception.
Tion Green’s 41-yard run then put Cincinnati in position to finish it off. Green had 90 yards on 15 carries.
The Bearcats had 300 yards in the first half, with Moore throwing for a touchdown and scoring on a 1-yard sneak.
Both defenses regrouped in the second half. The Hurricanes had 38 yards in the third quarter and missed a field-goal attempt, while Moore was sacked twice as the Bearcats managed only five net yards.
Moore finally got going, hitting Mekale McKay in stride for a 52-yard gain. He then threw a 7-yard touchdown pass for a 34-23 lead with 6:54 to go. The Hurricanes then had the chance to cut it to an eight.
Notable • The attorney for a Rutgers football player facing a domestic violence charge said Thursday they will petition the school to lift his indefinite suspension so he can play while the case is pending.
Attorney Peter Gilbreth said after Leonte Carroo was arraigned in Piscataway, N.J., municipal court that they will ask Rutgers to reassess its position since the trial won’t take place until at least mid-November.
The 21-year-old pleaded not guilty to an assault charge. Authorities allege he slammed a woman he once dated onto concrete after a game last month. The woman received injuries on her hip, hands, elbow and head.
• A new bowl game is coming to Arizona Stadium in Tucson in December.
The Arizona Bowl will feature teams from Conference USA, the Sun Belt or Mountain West Conference on Dec. 29 at Arizona’s home stadium.
The addition of the Arizona Bowl brings the total to a record 41 bowl games this season, meaning nearly two-thirds of FBS teams will play in bowl games.
